org.opends.sdk.util
Class Platform

java.lang.Object
  org.opends.sdk.util.Platform

public final class Platform
extends Object

Provides a wrapper class that collects all of the JVM vendor and JDK version specific code in a single place.

Method Detail

addCertificate

public static void addCertificate(KeyStore ks,
                                  String ksType,
                                  String ksPath,
                                  String alias,
                                  char[] pwd,
                                  String certPath)
                           throws KeyStoreException
Add the certificate in the specified path to the provided keystore; creating the keystore with the provided type and path if it doesn't exist.

Parameters:
ks - The keystore to add the certificate to, may be null if it doesn't exist.
ksType - The type to use if the keystore is created.
ksPath - The path to the keystore if it is created.
alias - The alias to store the certificate under.
pwd - The password to use in saving the certificate.
certPath - The path to the file containing the certificate.
Throws:
KeyStoreException - If an error occurred adding the certificate to the keystore.

deleteAlias

public static void deleteAlias(KeyStore ks,
                               String ksPath,
                               String alias,
                               char[] pwd)
                        throws KeyStoreException
Delete the specified alias from the provided keystore.

Parameters:
ks - The keystore to delete the alias from.
ksPath - The path to the keystore.
alias - The alias to use in the request generation.
pwd - The keystore password to use.
Throws:
KeyStoreException - If an error occurred deleting the alias.

generateCertificateRequest

public static File generateCertificateRequest(KeyStore ks,
                                              String ksType,
                                              String ksPath,
                                              String alias,
                                              char[] pwd,
                                              String dn)
                                       throws KeyStoreException
Generate a certificate request using the specified parameters.

Parameters:
ks - The keystore to use in the request creation.
ksType - The keystore type.
ksPath - The path to the keystore.
alias - The alias to use in the request generation.
pwd - The keystore password to use.
dn - A dn string to use as the certificate subject.
Returns:
A file object pointing at the created certificate request.
Throws:
KeyStoreException - If the certificate request failed.

generateSelfSignedCertificate

public static void generateSelfSignedCertificate(KeyStore ks,
                                                 String ksType,
                                                 String ksPath,
                                                 String alias,
                                                 char[] pwd,
                                                 String dn,
                                                 int validity)
                                          throws KeyStoreException
Generate a self-signed certificate using the specified alias, dn string and validity period. If the keystore does not exist, it will be created using the specified keystore type and path.

Parameters:
ks - The keystore to save the certificate in. May be null if it does not exist.
ksType - The keystore type to use if the keystore is created.
ksPath - The path to the keystore if the keystore is created.
alias - The alias to store the certificate under.
pwd - The password to us in saving the certificate.
dn - The dn string used as the certificate subject.
validity - The validity of the certificate in days.
Throws:
KeyStoreException - If the self-signed certificate cannot be generated.

normalize

public static void normalize(StringBuilder buffer)
Normalize the specified buffer.

Parameters:
buffer - The buffer to normalize.

isVendor

public static boolean isVendor(String vendor)
Test if a platform java vendor property starts with the specified vendor string.

Parameters:
vendor - The vendor to check for.
Returns:
true if the java vendor starts with the specified vendor string.
